definition: to be well matched/to suit
sort/kind/class/way/manner
see 般樂|般乐[pan2 le4]
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: Make sure the pieces you are about to weld fit together.
sentences.chinese: 确认要焊接的管件都般配。

sentences.english: To let them more similiar, we rewrote their resumes .
sentences.chinese: 为了让他们更般配，我们改写了他们的简历。

sentences.english: Before you solder, make sure that the pipes fit together properly.
sentences.chinese: 焊接之前，要确认管子是否般配。

sentences.english: Any special character preceded by an escape shall match itself.
sentences.chinese: 肆意特殊字符前边加转义符都般配本身。
而谁是和她最般配的男人？

sentences.english: Sarah are so badly matched, they should break up.
sentences.chinese: 柯林和萨拉太不般配了，他们应该分手才对。

definition: talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
to match/well-suited
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
similarity in features of an old couple/common facial traits that show predestination to be married together
a match made in heaven (idiom)
lit. golden boys and jade maidens (idiom)/attendants of the Daoist immortals/fig. lovely young children/a golden couple/(of a couple who are in the public eye) a lovely young couple
to match/in tune/reasonable
loving affection (in a couple)/conjugal love
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
lit. made by Heaven and arranged by Earth(idiom)/ideal/perfect/(of a match) made in heaven/to be made for one another
charming/attractive/delightful
visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
to love each other
perfect match
in time with (i.e. same rhythm)/to keep in step with/fig. to cooperate
